Apple Q3 2015 Financial Reports

From today Apple’s Q3 2015 financial reports:

  • iPhone unit sales grew 35%, revenue grew even more up to 59%. It’s sold 47.5 million.
  • They sold 10.9 million iPad, lesser than two previous quarter with Q1 21.4 million, Q2 12.6 million. Let’s see if iOS 9 will give iPad sales bumps next quarter.
  • Mac is sold 4.8 million, slightly higher than previous quarter with 4.6 million. Market research firm IDC says that PC shipments drop up to 12% while its rival, Garner says it fell down to 9.5%. At the same time, Apple’s Mac sales continue grew by 9%. Meanwhile Peter Cohen on iMore.
  • Apple earned 10.7 billion profit.

If you want to see some chart about Apple Q3 financial report then Macstories and SixColors have it for you.

Here’s some interesting tweet about Apple Q3 financial report:

“Other” was up $1B from last quarter. If Apple Watch ASP is $500, that’s 2 million watches.

— Eric Slivka (@eslivka) July 21, 2015

CNBC: TC says revenue in Greater China up ~112% in the quarter

— MacJournals.com (@macjournals) July 21, 2015

Whatever estimates u have for the AppleWatch 1 thing is for sure, Apple sold more Watches in 2Q15 than all other smartwatch vendors combined

— Francisco Jeronimo (@fjeronimo) July 21, 2015

Apple’s Other product category is now a billion dollars bigger this quarter. In other words, Apple Watch is a multi-$bn business already

— Steve T-S (@stroughtonsmith) July 21, 2015

Also of note: Apple Watch was only in stores for /2 weeks/ of last quarter

— Steve T-S (@stroughtonsmith) July 21, 2015

This is unbelievable. Apple's cash pile is now almost as big as all of Greece's GDP http://t.co/HcGxtD8sMK $AAPL pic.twitter.com/gART94Ryru
